metadata.dc:author: Suárez Parra, S
López Tizón, E
Suárez Baraza, J
metadata.dc:description: CASE REPORT We report the case of a diabetic twenty-five-year-old male with an asymptomatic bull's eye maculopathy in the left eye who was diagnosed by chance in a routine examination. The electrophysiological test showed a right eye photopic electroretinogram at the lower limit of normality. DISCUSSION In the presence of a bull's eye maculopathy we must rule out several pathologies like degenerative diseases, drug toxicity, previous trauma and infectious -- inflammatory diseases. Electrophysiology as well as family and personal history can help us to differentiate between several diseases though in our case the cause was unknown.
metadata.dc:title: Hallazgo casual de una maculopatía en "ojo de buey" unilateral.
[Chance discovery of a unilateral bull's eye maculopathy].
metadata.dc:publisher: Archivos de la Sociedad Espanola de Oftalmologia
